Section1.title: Listen, connect and grow
Section1.slogan: Listen and discover what your clients think, feel and need, transforming voice into strategy! Elia is here to help you.

Section2.text_1: Elia represents a revolution in customer understanding. Turn surveys into conversations and capture the true voices of your customers. Dare to listen to what they really think.
Section2.text_2: Elia is a revolutionary virtual surveyor designed to simplify the collection of information about your customers and products in a fast and direct way. With Elia, you can activate voice surveys to obtain responses from your customers efficiently and in real time.

Feat1.title: Meaningful conversations
Feat1.text: Hear the real and emotional responses of your customers through their voice.

Feat2.title: Smart analysis
Feat2.text: Get real-time statistics and advanced analytics for a complete view.

Feat3.title: Accurate data
Feat3.text: Each response is carefully processed to extract essential information.

Feat4.title: Detailed statistics
Feat4.text: Get frequency data, binary responses, open-ended responses from your customers.

Feat5.title: Listen to all your clients
Feat5.text: Elia allows you to listen to all your clients at the same time.

Feat6.title: Precise geolocation
Feat6.text: Analyze the location of your customers and understand how responses vary by geographic location.

1.title: Make strategic decisions
1.text: Use the information collected to improve your brand positioning.

2.title: Improve user experience
2.text: Adjust your product according to the needs of your users.

3.title: Find growth opportunities
3.text: Identify areas of innovation and improvement.

4.title: Make data-driven decisions
4.text: Use detailed analytics to drive growth and innovation through Artificial Intelligence.

Section7.text_1: Ready to transform the way you collect information from your customers?
Section7.text_2: Start listening to your customers and elevate their experience to a new level

AboutUs.paragraph_1: Elia allows you to ask questions guided by voice to all the people you want at the same time, process their answers and know what they are thinking through real-time statistics.
AboutUs.qst_desc_tf: You can create true-false questions for your customers and get their answer.
AboutUs.qst_desc_mc: You can create multiple-choice questions for your customers and get their answer.
AboutUs.qst_desc_des: You can create descriptive questions for your customers and get their answer.

Help.title: Help
Help.text_video: If you have questions about how to create a survey in Elia, the following video is for you.

Type1.title: Descriptive
Type1.text: The descriptive type question is one that seeks to obtain detailed information on a specific topic. These questions are usually open-ended and allow respondents to provide more detailed and complete answers. Instead of looking for short answers, they focus on gathering specific information to better understand participants' experiences, opinions, or behaviors.

Type2.title: Yes/No
Type2.text: The yes/no question is one that asks participants to respond affirmatively (Yes) or negatively (No) to a specific statement or statement. These questions are closed and seek to obtain direct and concise answers. Its main objective is to collect information quickly and efficiently, especially when seeking to obtain quantitative data or evaluate the prevalence of certain opinions or behaviors.

Type3.title: Multiple choice
Type3.text: The multiple choice question is one in which the respondent is presented with a statement or question, followed by several response options from which they must choose the one that best reflects their opinion, experience or preference. This format provides participants with a variety of options and allows data to be collected in a structured manner, facilitating quantitative analysis of responses. The person surveyed selects the option that he or she considers most appropriate among those provided.

Type4.title: Date
Type4.text: The date type question asks participants to provide information related to a specific date. This question type is used to collect temporal data, such as event dates, anniversaries, or any information that is tied to a point in time. The answers to these questions are usually entered in a date format, allowing precise information about the chronology of events or experiences to be obtained.

Type5.title: File
Type5.text: The file type question is one that asks participants to attach or provide a specific file as part of their answer. This question type allows respondents to attach relevant documents, images, PDFs, or other file types to support or expand their answers. It is useful when you need to collect detailed information that cannot be easily expressed in words or when additional documentation is required.

Type6.title: Rating
Type6.text: The rating question is one that seeks to evaluate the level of satisfaction, preference or performance of the participants in relation to a specific product, service or experience. These questions typically use numerical or descriptive rating scales, where respondents assign a score to the statement or item provided. The objective is to measure the opinion or perception of the participants in a quantitative and comparative way.

Type7.title: Credential
Type7.text: The credential question refers to a query that asks participants to provide specific information about their identity or affiliation. These questions seek to collect relevant demographic and contextual data, such as job title, organizational affiliation, educational level, or other details that help categorize and better understand respondents. They can be useful to analyze results according to different segments of the population.

Type8.title: Voice-only
Type8.text: The voice-only question means that a spoken response is expected rather than a written or selected response. Participants have the option to express their opinions, comments or responses using their voice instead of using written text. This format can be useful when you want to capture responses more naturally, allowing respondents to express their thoughts orally rather than being limited to predetermined options.

Type9.title: Rating with emojis
Type9.text: The emoji rating question in a survey uses emojis instead of numerical or descriptive scales to assess participants' level of satisfaction, preference, or experience. In this format, respondents are asked to choose or select an emoji that best represents their opinion or feeling about a product, service, or experience. This approach seeks to make the response more visual and accessible, allowing participants to express their evaluations in a more intuitive and emotional way through graphic icons.
